body.name: JLab Nightfall Gaming Headset with Near-Field Directional Flip-to-Mute Rotating Boom Mic, 50mm Drivers and Sound Isolating Inner Shelf, Wired 3.5mm for PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox one, Switch
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 56 mins
features: UNIVERSAL COMPATIBILITY: The wired 3.5mm connection cable provides a versatile and convenient audio solution for gaming and multimedia uses. Easily connect to various devices such as PC/Mac, Xbox, Playstation, and Nintendo Switch.

LAB QUALITY SOUND: Equipped with 50mm drivers and a sound isolating inner shelf, these Nightfall Gaming headphones deliver immersive and powerful sound, enhancing your gaming experience by providing rich audio with clarity and deep bass.

ROTATING MIC: The flip-to-mute rotating boom mic ensures clear team communications during gaming sessions. You can easily mute the microphone by flipping it up when you don't want to be heard or are playing solo. The rotating design allows you to position the mic optimally for better voice pickup.

ELIMINATE UNWANTED NOISE: The TeamSpeak Certified near-field directional mic captures your voice while eliminating background noise. This ensures that your teammates hear you clearly without any distractions, enhancing overall communication and teamwork in multiplayer games.

ALL-NIGHT COMFORT: The super-wide and adjustable headband offers a comfortable fit that can be customized to suit your head size. The stretchable design allows for all-night comfort, preventing discomfort or pressure points during extended gaming sessions. Plus the reversible design allows you to pick your style: Black or multicolor.

CLOUD FOAM QUIET: With Cloud Foam earcups, the Nightfall Gaming headset provides both comfort and noise isolation for fatigue-free gaming sessions. The earcups are designed to conform to the shape of your ears, providing a snug and comfortable fit, while providing passive noise isolation to block out external noise.
INCLUDES: JLab Nightfall Wired Gaming Headset, 3.5mm AUX Console Cord, JLab Two Year Warranty.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Connect to a variety of devices Universal Compatibility The wired 3.5mm connection cable provides a versatile and convenient audio solution for gaming and multimedia uses. Easily connect to various devices such as PC/Mac, Xbox, PS, and Nintendo Switch. Enhance your gaming experience Lab Quality Sound Equipped with 50mm drivers and a sound isolating inner shelf, these Nightfall Gaming headphones deliver immersive spatial audio and powerful sound, enhancing your gaming experience by providing rich audio with clarity and deep bass. Hear every footstep Spatial Audio The Nightfall gaming headset delivers an immersive gaming experience with support for Spatial Audio, providing players with a heightened sense of audio direction and depth, elevating gameplay to a whole new level. Immerse yourself in 3D soundscapes that bring your virtual worlds to life like never before. Quick-mute Rotating Mic The flip-to-mute rotating boom mic ensures clear team communications during gaming sessions. You can easily mute the microphone by flipping it up when you don't want to be heard or are playing solo. The rotating design allows you to position the mic optimally for better voice pickup.

TECH SPECS Driver 50mm Dynamic, Neodymium Magnet, 20-20kHz, 32 Ω Output 102 +/- 3 dB Microphone 1 x Condenser Microphone, Directional (-42 +/- 1 dB) Microphone Frequency Response 100 – 10k Hz Plug 3.5mm Aux Weight 250 g

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded my expectations for the price point
reviews.reviewText: Tested on Acer Predator gaming laptop and custom PC using AE-7 Sound Blaster sound card & software. Tested with PC games, Twitch streams, and streamed music.First, comfort: Ear cups are soft but warm (due to that pleather material). Headband takes some getting used to and adjustments. At first, I did not like the headband but after loosening it up a bit, I was able to tolerate it for hours at a time. The headphones are light and do not apply a lot of pressure to the ears.Sound Quality: Exceptional for the price (about $40 at time of review). For reference, I normally use Sennheiser HD 650s and have a slew of other headphones like Bose, Sony, AKG etc. Well balanced sound, slightly on the bassier side, but still with clarity. I had no difficulty picking up on all sorts of sounds while playing video games and watching Twitch (tested with the gaming laptop without an amp).When paired with the AE-7 Sound Blaster while listening to music, these cans pack a punch. Any 50mm headphones should be paired with some sort of amplifier to get the max benefits out of it. But, I get it, not all devices are going to support that. Slight distortion a full volume, however, at those levels you’ll be damaging your ears.Unfortunately, I was not able to test the microphone, but I have always been of the opinion a dedicated mic is best but not always possible.Overall, I have not tested a better set of headphones at $40. Absolutely recommend these. Four out of Five stars only due to the fact the head strap is a bit odd.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice sound quality and comfort!
reviews.reviewText: Very nice aesthetic, and the headband delivers on its promised comfort. Sound quality is very clear and nice for this price point, and the microphone folds out of the way when not in use, which is always a huge plus. The ear cups are SOFT and nice and deep. My only complaint is that it would be nice if the headset used a replaceable cord, as I like being able to use cords of different lengths at different settings or be able to replace it if the cord ever becomes damaged, but that's a matter of personal preference. Very impressed with these for their ~$40 asking price at time of review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First of all, the sound quality is not bad. It's not amazing, but for the price point, it isn't bad. The headset feels very light and hollow, which I'm not sure if it's a good thing or a bad thing.The comfort is the best part of the headset for me. The padding is very soft and thick, the headband also makes sure it will fit your head. I also really like the clean aesthetic look of the headset.As for the microphone, it's average. It's the same as any other gaming headset, which is not a bad thing.Overall, even though I don't think this headset is bad, I would always recommend going for headphones designed for music, (unless you really need the microphone) as you always get better sound quality and you get more features for the same price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best I've used at this price point.
reviews.reviewText: Things I like:The audio quality is decent, and it's not lacking in the mid or treble like a lot of budget sets. It's definitely comfy, the headband is a nice touch. The microphone swings up and down instead of retracting into the headset and it picks up audio well.Things I don't like:I have a large, but not huge, head and they barely fit at the widest setting. If I had a lot of curly hair that would be a problem. I could have done without the headband having a colored side, which you can still see when the black side is facing outward. Kinda defeats the purpose so I plan on getting a replacement. So an all black option would be nice as I wouldn't have wanted to spend the extra money upgrading had I not received this for review.All in all, I would recommend and my only criticisms are nitpicks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great sound quality headset
reviews.reviewText: The sound quality of headset is pretty good, it has good amount of bass and sound and can be used more than just a regular gaming headset. I am also happy this headset has volume control to increase or decrease volume. Only gripes I have is that the noise cancellation is good but not perfect no sound cancellation and my hair kind of gets trapped headband at times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Gaming Headset That Fits all My Needs
reviews.reviewText: This is a really nice gaming headset. I have had other products I've bought from JLabs in the past and never been disappointed. This is no exception. The sound is clear with a good balance of bass and the mic is clear and good pickup for your in-game sessions. It has a cool feature that mutes the mic when you rotate it away from your mouth which is really nice. The ear cushions are super soft and flexible and provide a very good seal that is also very comfortable. Overall a great headset that will provide many hours of enjoyable gaming with friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars too small for my head, great for the teen!
reviews.reviewText: this has decent quality sound, and looks sharp, but is too snug for my adult head to be comfortable.my teenage kid loves it and has it plugged into their tablet and playing roblox with it.i didn't test the microphone, but its cool looking. and the colored band adds some nice colored touches to it. the sounds is what you'd expect, and the durability seems fine too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy muffs and good sound quality
reviews.reviewText: Music matters to me a lot and gaming. These headphones are amazing. The ear muffs are really comfortable and they fit just fine. The sound quality is also great. Everything sounds so clear and the bass is just right.
